tool_description: Introducing the 1001 Operator by FX, an all-in-one API solution designed to streamline text processing, URL manipulation, HTML parsing, and more. Boost your application's efficiency with powerful algorithms such as Levenshtein, Cosine, and Jaccard for text comparisons, and perform seamless UTM tracking for your marketing campaigns. Extract and manipulate data from HTML documents and web pages with ease, all while enhancing your website's search engine ranking with our SEO-optimized API. Exper...
name: Operating Functions for 1001 Low and No Code Tools
title: Operating Functions for 1001 Low and No Code Tools
tool_name: Operating Functions for 1001 Low and No Code Tools

api_list.name: URLExpander
api_list.description: Given a shortened `url`, this endpoint returns the expanded one.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://operating-functions-for-1001-low-and-no-code-tools.p.rapidapi.com/operator/urlexpander"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "operating-functions-for-1001-low-and-no-code-tools.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: TextComparestring
api_list.description:
Endpoint can be called with _algorithm_ attribute. Available algorithms are:

- cosine
- diceCoefficient
- jaccardIndex
- lcs (Longest Common Subsequence)
- levenshtein
- mlcs (Metric Longest Common Subsequence
    

If left unspecified Leveneshtein's algorithm is default.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://operating-functions-for-1001-low-and-no-code-tools.p.rapidapi.com/text/comparestring"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "operating-functions-for-1001-low-and-no-code-tools.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: TextExtracttext
api_list.description: Extracts the content between two strings `start` and `end` of a text `body`. The argument `greedy` can be set to `true` so that the resulting text contains the start and end in it.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://operating-functions-for-1001-low-and-no-code-tools.p.rapidapi.com/text/extractor"
